abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column observes 100,000 city households are now required to place their organic garbage in designated bins to be shipped for composting to two farms north of city.
lead_paragraph: New York City is joining a garbage revolution, with 100,000 households now required to put their organic waste into designated bins.

headline.main: With Compost Program, Keeping Waste From Going to Waste
headline.print_headline: Keeping Waste From Going to Waste

snippet: New York City is joining a garbage revolution, with 100,000 households now required to put their organic waste into designated bins.
